MOD_VINAORA_CU3ER=mod_vinaora_cu3er
DESC_VINAORA_CU3ER=<h1>Vinaora Cu3er 3D Slideshow</h1><h3>User Interface</h3><p>User Interface enhances overall viewing experience enabling the user to get useful information (such as slide description or progress information while loading files) and to interact with the CU3ER (navigating trough slides or pausing the slideshow)</p><p><img src="../media/mod_vinaora_cu3er/images/docs/cu3er_overview.gif" style="border: solid 5px #ccc;" alt="General Settings"/></p><h3>General Settings</h3><p>"Slide panel" is your image/transition display area inside the CU3ER .swf file. Set your slide panel dimensions. Make sure they fit your image dimensions. Then align the 'panel' relative to the CU3ER stage. See the image below for possible align states:</p><p><img src="../media/mod_vinaora_cu3er/images/docs/general_aligment_settings.gif" style="border: solid 5px #ccc;" alt="General Settings"/></p><h3>Transition Settings</h3><p>3D Transitions represent the core feature  of the CU3ER. They are powerful, visually appealing yet very easy to set up. You can define your transition template and then override it with custom settings for each transition, if needed - by doing it this way you don't have to define each property over and over again, the CU3ER allows you to alter all you want once including the other attributes automatically.</p><p><img src="../media/mod_vinaora_cu3er/images/docs/slicing_direction.jpg" style="border: solid 5px #ccc;" alt="Transition Settings"/></p><h3>Button Settings</h3><p>Navigation buttons, represented as graphic shapes, are used for navigation through slides. Include the  node in order to display 'previous' or 'next' navigation button in the CU3ER. By clicking this button, you'll instruct the CU3ER to perform 3D transition and to show the previous defined slide in XML. Please take a look at following picture displaying possible scenarios for previous (navigation) button graphics with various round_corners settings:</p><p><img src="../media/mod_vinaora_cu3er/images/docs/navigation_buttons.gif" style="border: solid 5px #ccc;" alt="Navigation Settings"/></p><h3>Symbol Settings</h3><p>Having navigation buttons (prev/next) only, which are represented as simple graphic shapes, may not always be enough to provide the best viewing experience. In order to improve the navigation and enrich the slide viewing, a range of navigation symbols is supporting the navigation buttons. Their visual information is represented by 10 different arrow symbols that are telling the user very clearly which action they are able to perform.</p><p>There are 10 navigation symbols available:</p><p><img src="../media/mod_vinaora_cu3er/images/docs/navigation_symbols.gif" style="border: solid 5px #ccc;" alt="Symbol Settings"/></p>

POSTTEXT=Post-text
PRETEXT=Pre-text

DESC_POSTTEXT=The text or HTML code displays at the end of this module
DESC_PRETEXT=The text or HTML code displays at the top of this module

CONFIG_CODE=Config Name
DESC_CONFIG_CODE=Name of the config file. Warning: Don't edit this parameter if you don't know what to do.

SYMBOL_CIRCULAR=Circular
SYMBOL_LINEAR=Linear

PREVIOUS_BUTTON_DESC=<h1>PREVIOUS BUTTON</h1>
TWEENDEFAULTS_DESC=<h2>TWEENDEFAULTS</h2>
TWEENIN_DESC=<h2>TWEENIN, TWEENOUT, TWEENOVER</h2>
TWEENOUT_DESC=<h2>TWEENOUT</h2>
TWEENOVER_DESC=<h2>TWEENOVER</h2>


SILDE_DESC=<h2>SLIDES</h2><p>This is, obviously, the place where you define all slide properties such as image url, link, description content. Please, notice that this is the only XML node with a complex/nested structure in which the properties such as the node content (url, link, heading & paragraph) and node attributes (target) are included. </p>
TRANSITION_DESC=<h2>TRANSITIONS</h2><p>3D Transitions represent the core feature  of the CU3ER. They are powerful, visually appealing yet very easy to set up. You can define your transition template and then override it with custom settings for each transition, if needed – by doing it this way you don’t have to define each property over and over again, the CU3ER allows you to alter all you want once including the other attributes automatically. </p>

DESC_TWEEN_ALPHA=Range from 0 - 1. Alpha/ transparency of the object
DESC_TWEEN_DELAY=Delay (in seconds) before the tween begins
DESC_TWEEN_HEIGHT=height
DESC_TWEEN_ROTATION=rotation (in degrees)
DESC_TWEEN_SCALEX=Range from 0 - max. Horizontal scale of the object
DESC_TWEEN_SCALEY=Range from 0 - max. Vertical scale of the object
DESC_TWEEN_TIME=Duration (in seconds) of the tween
DESC_TWEEN_TINT=Hexdecimal number. Color of the object.
DESC_TWEEN_WIDTH=width
DESC_TWEEN_X=x position
DESC_TWEEN_Y=y position

TWEEN_ALPHA=Alpha

TWEEN_SCALEY=ScaleY

TWEEN_WIDTH=Width
TWEEN_X=x

TRANSITION_CUBER_COLOR=Cuber Color(s)

TRANSITION_Z_MULTIPLIER=Z multiplier(s)

DESC_TRANSITION_CUBER_COLOR=Cube faces color
DESC_TRANSITION_DELAY=Time each cube will wait before starting transition (in seconds)
DESC_TRANSITION_DIRECTION=Transition direction / cubes rotation direction -left, right, up, down
DESC_TRANSITION_DURATION=Time (needed) for each sliced cube transition (in seconds)
DESC_TRANSITION_LIGHT_POSITION=Use this attribute to define x, y & z light position for shading (works only if shader is not set to 'none')
DESC_TRANSITION_NUM=Number of slices each transition consists of
DESC_TRANSITION_SHADER=Transition shading type - none, flat, phong
DESC_TRANSITION_SLICING=Direction of cube slicing - horizontal or vertical
DESC_TRANSITION_Z_MULTIPLIER=BezierTrough effect over 'z' axis during transition

DESC_SLIDE_UI_VISIBILITY_TIME=CU3ER detects user activity/inactivity (mouse move). If user is inactive for the specified period of time (in seconds), tweenOut is applied for all UI elements
